_description: Neighborhood content schema template for scalable long-tail SEO pages. Each neighborhood must include 8-15 specific local intel points.

_validationRules.localIntel: Must include 8-15 specific local details (total across all categories)
_validationRules.cons: Must include at least 1 con for balanced assessment

name: {{neighborhood_name}}
title: {{neighborhood_title}}

localIntel._instructions: Total of 8-15 specific local details required across all categories below. Each point must be specific and non-generic.
localIntel._streetsNote: Include 2-4 specific streets with character descriptions (e.g., 'Orange Avenue - main commercial strip, bustling with shops')
localIntel._pocketFeelNote: Include 2-3 pocket feel descriptions (e.g., 'Blocks between X and Y avenues feel quieter and more residential')
localIntel._beachAccessNote: Include 2-3 exact beach access locations (e.g., 'Ocean Boulevard at 1st Street - main beach access')
localIntel._parkingPatternsNote: Include 2-3 street-by-street parking notes (e.g., 'Street parking is tight after 5pm on Main Street')
localIntel._schoolNotesNote: Include 2-3 school proximity and quality notes (e.g., 'Coronado Elementary is a 5-minute walk from most homes')
localIntel._shoppingClustersNote: Include 2-3 specific shopping areas/stores (e.g., 'Orange Avenue between 8th and 10th has the best local shops')
localIntel._trafficPatternsNote: Optional: Include 1-2 commute and traffic notes (e.g., 'Morning commute to downtown is 15 minutes via bridge')
localIntel._noiseLevelsNote: Optional: Include 1-2 noise assessments (e.g., 'Quieter than Shores, but some street noise on main arteries')
localIntel._walkabilityNote: Optional: Include Walk Score or description (e.g., 'Walk Score: 92 - most errands can be done on foot')
localIntel._publicTransitNote: Optional: Include 1-2 transit access notes (e.g., 'Bus stops on Orange Avenue every 15 minutes')

_prosNote: Include 3-5 specific pros. Must be honest and specific (e.g., 'Excellent walkability to shops, restaurants, and beach')
_consNote: Include 2-4 specific cons for balanced assessment (e.g., 'Parking can be challenging for visitors')

marketContext._priceRangeNote: Include price range with disclaimer (e.g., '$1.5M - $4M+ (varies by property type and condition)')
marketContext._typicalDomNote: Optional: Include typical days on market (e.g., '28-45 days')

_faqsNote: Include 3-5 neighborhood-specific FAQs. Questions should address common buyer concerns about this specific neighborhood.

_example.name: Village
_example.title: Village Neighborhood
_example.description: The heart of Coronado Island, featuring walkable streets, classic architecture, and local shops.
_example.intro: The Village is Coronado's historic core, offering walkable streets, classic architecture, and a vibrant local community. This neighborhood combines historic charm with modern convenience. Located between Orange Avenue and the beach, the Village provides easy access to shops, restaurants, and the iconic Hotel del Coronado.

faqs.a: Yes, Village has a Walk Score of 92. Most errands can be done on foot, with easy access to shops, restaurants, and the beach.

faqs.q: What is parking like in Village?
faqs.a: Street parking is available but can be tight after 5pm. Most homes have driveways or garages. Public parking lots are available for visitors.

faqs.q: Are there HOA fees in Village?
faqs.a: Some areas have HOA restrictions, but fees vary by specific location. Many Village homes do not have HOA fees.

_contentQualityGuidelines.specificity: Every local intel point must be specific and non-generic. Use exact street names, specific locations, and concrete details.

examples.good: Orange Avenue between 8th and 10th has the best local shops

_contentQualityGuidelines.localKnowledge: Each point should demonstrate deep local knowledge that competitors don't have. Include insider details about parking, traffic patterns, noise levels, etc.
_contentQualityGuidelines.buyerValue: Every point should help buyers make informed decisions. Focus on practical information like parking, walkability, school proximity, and neighborhood character.
